feed.title: Security Advisory for Java artifacts hosted at the Maven central repository
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for Java artifacts hosted at the Maven central repository on GitHub

entry.title: [com.erudika:para-core] Business Logic Errors in Para
entry.content:
Paraara prior to version 1.46.0 is vulnerable to business logic errors. A user can create more than one app, even after they reach the app limit.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-1848
  • https://github.com/erudika/para/commit/fa677c629842df60099daa9c23bd802bc41b48d1
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/8dfe0877-e44b-4a1a-8eee-5c03c93ae90a
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4793-8wwh-jxxr

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:openshift-deployer] OpenShift Deployer Plugin does not perform permission checks in methods implementing form validation
entry.content:
A missing permission check in Jenkins OpenShift Deployer Plugin 1.2.0 and earlier allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to check for the existence of an attacker-specified file path on the Jenkins controller file system and to upload a SSH key file from the Jenkins controller file system to an attacker-specified URL.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36909
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-1375%20(2)
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-78fg-pvgg-6g3r

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:rpmsign-plugin] Jenkins rpmsign-plugin before 0.5.1 does not perform a permission check in a method implementing form validation
entry.content:
Jenkins rpmsign-plugin Plugin 0.5.0 and earlier does not perform a permission check in a method implementing form validation, allowing attackers with Item/Read permission but without Item/Workspace or Item/Configure permission to check whether attacker-specified file patterns match workspace contents.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36893
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-2403
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-pw4g-jcp5-63m9

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:rhnpush-plugin] Jenkins rhnpush-plugin does not perform a permission check in a method implementing form validation
entry.content:
Jenkins rhnpush-plugin Plugin 0.5.1 and earlier does not perform a permission check in a method implementing form validation, allowing attackers with Item/Read permission but without Item/Workspace or Item/Configure permission to check whether attacker-specified file patterns match workspace contents.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36892
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-2402
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-w8gx-4r6w-3rx9

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:deployer-framework] Jenkins Deployer Framework Plugin does not restrict application path of applications when configuring a deployment
entry.content:
Jenkins Deployer Framework Plugin 85.v1d1888e8c021 and earlier does not restrict the application path of the applications when configuring a deployment, allowing attackers with Item/Configure permission to upload arbitrary files from the Jenkins controller file system to the selected service.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36889
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-2764
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j5qq-6rpm-qjgh

entry.title: [com.compuware.jenkins:compuware-ispw-operations] Jenkins Compuware ISPW Operations Plugin does not perform permission checks in several HTTP endpoints
entry.content:
A missing permission check in Jenkins Compuware ISPW Operations Plugin 1.0.8 and earlier allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to enumerate hosts and ports of Compuware configurations and credentials IDs of credentials stored in Jenkins.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36898
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-2628
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-cp5r-xqjr-84gm

entry.title: [com.compuware.jenkins:compuware-topaz-utilities] Jenkins Compuware Topaz Utilities Plugin is missing authorization
entry.content:
A missing permission check in Jenkins Compuware Topaz Utilities Plugin 1.0.8 and earlier allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to enumerate hosts and ports of Compuware configurations and credentials IDs of credentials stored in Jenkins.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36895
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-2619
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qf4p-7gqc-x6jx

entry.title: [com.compuware.jenkins:compuware-scm-downloader] Jenkins Compuware Source Code Download is missing authorization
entry.content:
A missing permission check in Jenkins Compuware Source Code Download for Endevor, PDS, and ISPW Plugin 2.0.12 and earlier allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to enumerate hosts and ports of Compuware configurations and credentials IDs of credentials stored in Jenkins.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36896
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-2621
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-75fc-fv3p-xh82

entry.title: [com.compuware.jenkins:compuware-xpediter-code-coverage] Jenkins Compuware Xpediter Code Coverage Plugin Missing Authorization
entry.content:
A missing permission check in Jenkins Compuware Xpediter Code Coverage Plugin 1.0.7 and earlier allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to enumerate hosts and ports of Compuware configurations and credentials IDs of credentials stored in Jenkins.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36897
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-2626
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hxf7-9rv9-88v6

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:clif-performance-testing] Jenkins CLIF Performance Testing Plugin allows attackers to replace arbitrary files with other content
entry.content:
An arbitrary file write vulnerability in Jenkins CLIF Performance Testing Plugin 64.vc0d66de1dfb_f and earlier allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to create or replace arbitrary files on the Jenkins controller file system with attacker-specified content.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36894
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-2413
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6xf5-c3cx-67pv

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:git] Jenkins Git Plugin before 4.11.4 allows attackers to trigger builds of jobs to use an attacker-specified Git repo
entry.content:
A cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Jenkins Git Plugin 4.11.3 and earlier allows attackers to trigger builds of jobs configured to use an attacker-specified Git repository and to cause them to check out an attacker-specified commit.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36882
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-284
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8xwj-2wgh-gprh

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:buckminster] Jenkins Buckminster Plugin does not perform a permission check in a method implementing form validation
entry.content:
Jenkins Buckminster Plugin 1.1.1 and earlier does not perform a permission check in a method implementing form validation, allowing attackers with Overall/Read permission to check for the existence of an attacker-specified file path on the Jenkins controller file system.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36918
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-2747
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-79x9-477g-w256

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:openshift-deployer] Jenkins OpenShift Deployer Plugin allows attackers to check for file path, upload SSH key file
entry.content:
A cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Jenkins OpenShift Deployer Plugin 1.2.0 and earlier allows attackers to check for the existence of an attacker-specified file path on the Jenkins controller file system and to upload a SSH key file from the Jenkins controller file system to an attacker-specified URL.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36908
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-1375%20(2)
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5mv2-vqq7-mq5h

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:openshift-deployer] Jenkins OpenShift Deployer Plugin allows connection to attacker-specified URL using attacker-specified credentials
entry.content:
A cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Jenkins OpenShift Deployer Plugin 1.2.0 and earlier allows attackers to connect to an attacker-specified URL using attacker-specified username and password.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36906
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-1375%20(1)
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8528-c6m6-gppm

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:openshift-deployer] Jenkins OpenShift Deployer Plugin does not perform a permission check in a method implementing form validation
entry.content:
A missing permission check in Jenkins OpenShift Deployer Plugin 1.2.0 and earlier allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to connect to an attacker-specified URL using attacker-specified username and password.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36907
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-1375%20(1)
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jvjh-9r4q-8q5q

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:repository-connector] Jenkins Repository Connector Plugin does not perform a permission check in a method implementing form validation
entry.content:
Jenkins Repository Connector Plugin 2.2.0 and earlier does not perform a permission check in a method implementing form validation, allowing attackers with Overall/Read permission to check for the existence of an attacker-specified file path on the Jenkins controller file system.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36904
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-2665%20(2)
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-fjpq-f574-jc45

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:repository-connector] Jenkins Repository Connector Plugin allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to enumerate credentials IDs
entry.content:
A missing permission check in Jenkins Repository Connector Plugin 2.2.0 and earlier allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to enumerate credentials IDs of credentials stored in Jenkins.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36903
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-2665%20(1)
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-76pg-mr9v-5vwc

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:http_request] Jenkins HTTP Request Plugin stores HTTP Request passwords unencrypted
entry.content:
Jenkins HTTP Request Plugin 1.15 and earlier stores HTTP Request passwords unencrypted in its global configuration file on the Jenkins controller where they can be viewed by users with access to the Jenkins controller file system.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36901
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-2053
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2qh6-hhvv-m2ww

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:git] Jenkins Git Plugin before 4.11.4 provides unauthenticated attackers information about the existence of jobs
entry.content:
The webhook endpoint in Jenkins Git Plugin 4.11.3 and earlier provide unauthenticated attackers information about the existence of jobs configured to use an attacker-specified Git repository.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36884
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-284
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-449w-c77c-vmf6

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:coverity] Jenkins Coverity Plugin is missing authorization, leading to Credential Capture
entry.content:
A missing permission check in Jenkins Coverity Plugin 1.11.4 and earlier allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to connect to an attacker-specified URL using attacker-specified credentials IDs obtained through another method, capturing credentials stored in Jenkins.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-36921
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-07-27/#SECURITY-2790%20(2)
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/07/27/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-99mq-hw5m-gwjj
